Trigger.Name: Insert abilities in list for each party member
Draw/update ability
Trigger.RegularExpression: index:(?<index>\d{1,2}) playerindex:(?<playerindex>\d) ability:(?<ability>[\w-'èéêîïôàæûç, ]{1,51}) image:"(?<image>[a-zA-Z-0-9:\\\/.]{1,99})" (?:duration:(?<duration>\d{1,3}))? cooldown:(?<cooldown>\d{1,3}) level:(?<level>\d{2}) used:(?<used>\d)(?: onyou:(?<onyou>\d))?(?: leavecd:(?<leavecd>\d))?(?: statustype:(?<statustype>\d))?(?: status:(?<status>[\w-'èéêîïôàæûç,% ]{1,51}))?(?: notime:(?<notime>\d))?

Trigger.Name: Insert card abilities in list for each AST member
Insert card abilities in list for each BRD member
Song Update
Trigger.RegularExpression: 1[AE]:[A-F0-9]{8}:(?<player>[a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31}) (?<status>gains|loses) the effect of (?<song>The Wanderer's Minuet|Mage's Ballad|Army's Paeon) from (?<caster>[a-zA-Z-' ]{1,31})(?:\.| for)

Trigger.Name: README -> Description
Trigger.Description:
Thanks for checking out my repository.
Video on setting it up: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=klKDNfzPWSI
Currently there's Visual Dot Timers and Visual Buff Tracker, still want to get more in :)
Most of the DoT regex's are taken from Aho's TTS callouts for them. Thanks Aho! MNK Demolish Regex taken from dansa (from Smol Cute Monk Suite). Thanks dansa! Idea of plugable party cooldown monitor taken from Illidra/Lombax. Thanks Illidra!
By default the DoT Tracker sits at 650, 690 and the Buff Tracker at 650, 780. You can change these locations by following these steps (thanks Aho for some of your text!):
1 - Make a folder in your Local Triggers, name it whatever you want. 2 - Copy&Paste the "SETTINGS -> Copy to your Startup Folder" trigger in that new folder 3 - Select said folder as a Startup Folder under : Options -> Edit Configuration -> General -> Startup Folder 4 - Restart ACT or disable/enable the Triggernometry Plugin
In the case you want any DoT Timer or Buff Timer to have a different location from the general settings you can go in the triggers and replace "if(${var:ZeffSettingsLoaded},${var:DoTTrackerX},650)" with just the X or Y location for example: 400
For the Visual Party Cooldowns you'll want to have Triggernometry's party list order the same as ingames. To change this go to Options -> Edit configuration -> Final Fantasy XIV tab -> Set ordering method to "Player first, sort the rest by custom party order". The options underneath this match the default FFXIV settings.
Make sure you set the PartyTrackerScale to whatever your party list scale is so the cooldowns line up with the player. So 80% = 0.8, 120% = 1.2 etc.
I'll make more as I get information from players.
If you need help or want to send a suggestion my way you can contact me on Discord @Zeffuro#3033

Trigger.Name: VIDEO HOW TO SETUP IN README DESCRIPTION
Trigger.Description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=klKDNfzPWSI
In case you actually looked here, I've also got you covered :3
But seriously, read the readme after the video :D

Trigger.Name: SETTINGS -> Copy to your Startup Folder

Action.AuraName: DoubleClick this to check X and Y coordinates
